text: The 2012–13 season will be Al-Minaa's 37th season in the Iraqi Premier League, having featured in all 39 editions of the competition except two. ==Squad== ==Transfers== ===In=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Name |- | Coach | Ghazi Fahad |- | rowspan="2" |Assistant coach | Munir Jaber |- | Ihsan Hadi |- | Fitness coach | Ali Lafta |- | Goalkeeping coach | Saddam Salman |- | Club doctor | Abdul Abbas Jabbar ==Board members== ==Stadium== During the previous season, the stadium of Al-Mina'a demolished. A company will build a new stadium that will be completed in 2015. Since they can't play their games at Al Mina'a Stadium, they will be playing at Az-Zubair Olympic Stadium during this season. ==Matches== ===Iraqi Premier League=== :: Away matches :: Home matches ===Summary table=== ==Top scorers== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;font-size:100%" |- !width=20 |# !width=180 |Name !width=40 |Goals |- | 1 || align=left|Nasser Talla Dahilan|| 9 |- | 2 || align=left|Hassan Hamoud|| 8 |- | 3 || align=left| Claude Gnakpa|| 6 |- | 4 || align=left|Hamid Mido || 5 |- | 5 || align=left| Nawaf Falah|| 4 |- | 6 || align=left|Ahmed Sadeq || 3 |- | 7 || align=left|Alaa Al-Sasi || 3 |- | 8 || align=left|Ali Hosni || 3 |- | 9 || align=left|Ahmed Shershab || 2 |- | 10 || align=left|Mohammed Jabbar Rubat || 2 |- | 11 || align=left|Faisal Kadhim|| 2 |- | 12 || align=left|Anas Jassim || 1 |- | 13 || align=left|Haider Sari|| 1 |- | 14 || align=left|Hussein Mohsin|| 1 |} ==Sources== * Iraqi League 2012/2013 * Al-Minaa SC: Transfers and News * Iraqia Sport TV Category:Al-Mina'a SC seasons Al Mina
